page.title: 01 OVERALL PICTURE
page.content: The block of 12 sq.kms. covered by our study represents a generally flat, quiet, rural corner of Cambridgeshire- pleasant and safe for the children yet, ironically, only 7 miles from the Nuclear Base at Molesworth. It is an arable farming area, with the main settlement being focussed on the village of{Gt.Staughton, (pop. circa 700) situated on the main A45 from Northampton to Cambridge, and smaller settlements in the hamlet of {Dillington}and the southern outskirts of{Perry. In Gt.Staughton there is a Parish Church, Village Hall, a thriving Primary School, a large Playing Field and basic shops and amenities. There is a wealth of clubs and social activities, and a rich community spirit is enjoyed.
